description.narrative: (Zambia): Read to Succeed (RTS) will assist the Ministry of Education (MOE) to improve learner performance in public primary schools in the six target provinces with consistently poor learning outcomes. Activities will: -Train and mentor teachers to use the five major components of reading instruction in local languages and English; -Build the capacity of school principals in instructional leadership and management; -Promote evidence-based decision making to guide instructional processes in teaching reading; -Increase the use of classroom-based, teacher-led assessments to promote effective instruction; -Support the promotion of local languages as the medium of instruction, as well as the transition into English; -Increase community support to schools and provide psychosocial support to orphans and vulnerable children; and -Develop a transition strategy for local ownership and sustainability.
